FBD734CBC8B44128AAE4F577D4D35A16.description:
The student will examine trends in Deaf Education:
American Sign Language, Oralism, Cued Speech, Bilingualism-Biculturalism,
Total Communication and Signed Exact English.

C6ECEDC8D96F453CA8A6C9B8AED84815.description:
The student will identify and describe important events and people in Deaf
Education history: French Deaf education in the 1700s, American Deaf
education in the 1800s, Abbe de l’Eppe, Abbe Sicard, Jean Massieu, Laurent
Clerc, Thomas Hopkins Gallaudet, Alice Cogswell, Dr. Mason Cogswell, Edward
Miner Gallaudet, Gallaudet University, Alexander Graham Bell, the Milan
Conference, Public Law 94-142, Deaf President Now protest, Section 504 of
Rehabilitation Act of 1973.

8F76993CB3C74B82AE4C5D74C08E024A.description:
The student will recognize different signacy techniques:
 Cheers, ABC stories, handshape stories, poetry, songs and drama.

50405AB5129A43ED9729E6C6089D6059.description:
The student will explain the history of Deaf technological devices:
Western Union TTYs, modern TTYs, alarm clocks, baby cry signal lights, closed
caption devices, televisions with built-in closed captioning, relay services, door
lights, phone lights, Reveille and cochlear implants.

1F53DCCFB0B346B9A5544BB9483D5ABC.description:
The student will describe the cultural importance of Deaf jokes, legends and
stories: Importance of Deaf jokes in the community, Deaf soldiers in the Civil
War, and Deaf school stories and adventures.

D1D120443C5F4C11BF56B0915C8C3D12.description:
The student will identify everyday experiences of Deaf people:
Accessibility of TTYs, public announcements; getting, directing and maintaining
attention; interpreting services, and Deaf frustrations in a hearing world.

88507007A1EC47B2BCFB0C30AC4191BC.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

E8DD07C15986428181DACAC05654CED3.description: Give their opinion of the recommended place.

BE977FF122C94418A3CB786E8ADAC041.description: Describe the cost, location, and what to do or see there.

0DD9B653C1AF498C8812BEFF89A984DB.description: The student will be able to recommend and describe places to visit.

5BB4916122DB475491FAA66CD8D34BB1.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

FFC3B7B1131F4816A0E3669284AA4029.description:
Describe how they feel when plans are disrupted.
 (i.e. demonstrate the degree of their feelings).

109B53E461AC4E8797185E33C026CED2.description:
Describe how weekend plans are disrupted (i.e. weather, health problems, house
problems, car problems, personal reasons, or job-related reasons).

6159A40A31274224BDCE040D74471DC8.description:
The student will be able to describe different ways their plans have been
disrupted.

EA7D606ECB2F4F3B8821605420B89EE8.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

4006939C40DF4E00B821D8516CAFE609.description: Describe the itinerary of activities for a weekend

C3B1ECD6749042BAAEDF50EDEB9CED61.description:
For one season, discuss places they go or a trip they have taken and their opinion
about it.

E4DBC453E109444C96C17E942D97002D.description: For one season, discuss tasks they do and their feelings when done.

574972902B444559AB44295BDFEA3577.description:
The student will be able to describe a variety of activities they do each
season.

CD1A05CAFDC244C6B7DE0981CB35B727.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

145DFD4D79074E568B7F277692D421F0.description: Describe how food is made in the correct order.

B2B3DCFC13884D7AAC9202EB04979004.description: Correctly name the ingredients in a recipe.

6A7D390198854F63A4C153D83E1F74B2.description: The student will be able to describe food by how it is made.

8BB2E1B1B7C64088AC1265DEFF10976F.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

54830237BCBE428BA249069578D9F20E.description: Tell the cost of items up to $100.00.

101132252C5F40CC964C75506A1E6773.description:
Describe objects from the correct perspective.
 (Front, neutral, rear, sitting, on your body).

C454E296A63746879C65052FB629A332.description: Appropriately describe symmetrical and/or asymmetrical objects.

EAA153A502EC447497B013971C06873E.description: Describe textures and/or patterns of objects.

B6B1D2065B90450AB44ACEEB6AD37069.description: Describe objects using correct instrument classifiers.

2F722B2C710446829A9EEF857C3DF67D.description: Describe objects using correct descriptive classifiers.

B745AE1CADCC4264A12B750B5C5D01FE.description:
The student will be able to describe objects by how they look, how they work,
and how much they cost.

15270EB710534F2BB852188570C7C752.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

3BC82219187745F49514115474303B46.description: Describe reasons for immigration including specific years.

6B9BC35C125C4A199323F863A5B8648A.description: Describe their family nationality using contrastive structure.

AE57A8CD1CE64C4B8A78644D7308033A.description: Use a variety of country signs.

6051B9872D8844AA8665841738B1E194.description: The student will be able to describe nationalities and family backgrounds.

3CE7C7B5FFB644049688ABAF69A89B16.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

263586C8100C4D5280411C221637865F.description: Use when clauses (age, year, previous event).

37CAAF4885FC40DCA531EF9B3920B638.description: The student will be able to describe life events using various transitions.

371F4FC64A1A48F286051030B8A12E7B.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

DEC64D32BD8A46C48370710058581517.description: Agree with a condition or decline and tell why.

CC554F23C3224ED29F66FD15CADFF09F.description:
Demonstrate use of appropriate registers according to formality
 (i.e. “permit me” or “not-mind”).

108CAB2DBA694697833D83A074C639B4.description: The student will be able to ask for permission to borrow something.

68C3A57EF5524ACEB34119D2AAAA23FA.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

C922DBC90D3E476AA1EED36F1C13C42F.description: Sign specific clock numbers correctly. (i.e. 10:47, 6:25, etc.).

212176F3F0524FFE962EDDA183030E6B.description:
Demonstrate negotiation skills by declining a request and suggesting
another solution.

4E7B0A74EB0A46F982669D9E4A6A7F9D.description: Ask a favor involving a third person.

5390B349B0B141CA9FE7B6CFDC300FCF.description: State the reason for their request.

C3F416F8361E4793B6D68E8CC0777453.description: The student will be able to make a request and negotiate an agreement.

6970A980FB854646A757D0E7A728EC49.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

83C06315564A42F9ABB84A90D47BF0EB.description:
Make several complaints about others.
(pets, children, roommates/spouse, and neighbors).

00932C862C3740DF8080F8D45EE2E012.description: The student will be able to complain about others and make suggestions.

F9DECA2269044DE081DE0BDD5026E66C.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

F0CC11D6CDE64F7299909F6B45BC5220.description: Describe the timeline of the ailment (uninflected, recurring, continuous).

C906595D12EA41038E3A7C237C462791.description: Describe the degrees of severity of the ailment and its location.

E7BAD17275AB4902A5121055002F1EA8.description: The student will be able to describe ailments and make suggestions.

11982703FACC40EC84E93C1F0571E1F6.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

3ECC765F498D410290740805FB546BD7.description: Describe the locations of household items within a room.

7C3AE45781DA4772AD260EE60C22497C.description: Describe location of furniture using appropriate classifiers.

6C3DC0C0086C4AD1BE18E3F240FABB3B.description: The student will be able to describe locations of items around the house.

7B5CF57895D24B6EAE2B11359D76CFE0.description: Produce signs in correct ASL word order.

FAEAC7D387FD4A1DB460B9D5A6B0FF07.description:
Use varying non-manual markers appropriately.
(varying and appropriate facial expressions).

72C4CF969006412B9E5E87E1EF923381.description: The student will be able describe a floor plan.

D960197ADC5A4263A701DD4326FEF84B.description: Recognize feelings and opinions about disrupted plans and disasters.

231AF8DEAFEC41AABAD3AF2C03879E57.description: Recognize feelings and opinions about activities.

4D2AD83427DF49DC8164A604662DBE4E.description: Recognize time signs with durative aspects.

A48D8EBBF6794805A165736FC7EB5CBB.description:
The student will be able to recognize and understand seasonal tasks and
activities.

7F7797B6FC974C5D8839B27C4D49C5A6.description: Recognize how something works and how it is made.

844CC3D6CB274D95B1F6A93EE7117530.description: Recognize non-manual markers related to descriptions.

82F9A58B51474E2BA1D197D41EE6C193.description:
The student will be able to recognize and understand descriptions and
identifications of objects and food.

35850E7474204A58AFB67E076C19A649.description: Recognize the exchange of personal information.

FB6660F5B8924B6FA7FC0ECACE1FE62A.description: Recognize the numbers 110-119, dates and addresses.

D6ABCE5442B14D6D8F1D1698B8163909.description: Recognize narratives of why families move and family histories.

85C57B38C6EE4B5890EDA959E0125A69.description:
Recognize various ethnic backgrounds of families including countries and
 continents.

F52D2D09E9B147CEB45DCDBFE45BCB88.description: Recognize unexpected changes in life events.

E26BF2AE9E62464AAFD4AE5CF67BB066.description: Recognize the sequence of when clauses.

939CCE2572FE421AB58F77EF1FD5D3D1.description: The student will be able to recognize and understand the exchange of personal information: life events, nationalities and family backgrounds.

BB14EA53E44543808E1EDF37B4F5E08E.description: Recognize recurring and continuous inflected verbs.

0F9B59930F3944E0BA3B596492135594.description:
The student will be able to recognize and understand complaints, suggestions
and requests.

C90A0F04C83A4D13BCE46120F1BF1ADA.description: Recognize location of items present and non-present.

4B91C28017B6422B85AEC884C470B69E.description:
Recognize numbers 101-109 and numbers counting by
hundreds.

7396543A1F2D4E14BCAF2E21FFAAE868.description:
The student will be able to recognize and locate objects around the house and
location of non-present items.
